page.title: 12Scunthorpe Family Weekend I
page.content: { Scunthorpe Family Weekend}started as an added attraction at the athletics and cycling meeting at{Quibell Park. It was taken on by the{Scunthorpe {Federation of Community Centres}about 17 years ago and was then a single day but has now grown into a two day festival. The Chairman of the federation, together with about 300 volunteers, organise all the many things needed for such an event, from tickets to tea, from electricity laid on to looking after lost children. One of the regular attractions is a {parade}of decorated floats. There were 26 floats this year (1985), including Cubs and scouts, Viking Radio, Frederick Gough Swiming Club and local youth clubs. The floats started from Everest Road and paraded through town to Quibell Park.
